intro: Kohlrauschia glumacea, commonly known as the slender leaved grass, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Kohlrauschia glumacea is adapted to arid conditions and has a relatively short growing season.
